title: Composition and method of making biodegradable pellets

classifications.description: Starch; Degradation products thereof, e.g. dextrin
Starch; Degradation products thereof, e.g. dextrin
Polyvinyl alcohol; Partially hydrolysed homopolymers or copolymers of esters of unsaturated alcohols with saturated carboxylic acids

abstract: Biodegradable pellet compositions comprising: a starch; a plasticizer; a flexibility agent; a binder at a hydrophobic agent; and an emulsifier. The compositions further comprise a defoaming agent and may optionally include a plant fiber. Methods of producing the compositions are also described.
claims: 1. A biodegradable plastic pellet composition, the composition comprising: a starch at about 20% to about 85% by weight of the composition, a plasticizer at about 2% to about 30% by weight of the composition; a flexibility agent at about 10% to about 40% by weight of the composition; a binder at about 0.5% to about 15% by weight of the composition; a hydrophobic agent at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition; and an emulsifier at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition.
2. The composition of claim 1, wherein the starch is a starch powder selected from the group consisting of com starch, wheat starch, potato starch, buckwheat starch and any mixture thereof.
3. The composition of claim 2, wherein the starch powder is at least one of unprocessed potato powder and unprocessed corn starch powder.
4. The composition of claim 1, wherein the starch has an amylose to amylopectin ratio of about 1 :2 to about 1 :5.
5. The composition of claim 1, wherein the starch has a moisture content of between about 15% to 25% by weight of the starch.
6. The composition of claim 1, wherein the plasticizer is selected from the group consisting of glycerol, ethylene glycol, polyglycerol and any mixture thereof.
7. The composition of claim 6, wherein the plasticizer is glycerol.
8. The composition of claim 1, wherein the flexibility agent is urea, citric acid, a polyol or any mixture thereof.

9. The composition of claim 8, wherein the polyol is selected from the group consisting of sorbitol, D-glucitol, mannitol, polyethylene glycol, polyvinyl alcohol, polyglycerol and any mixture thereof.
10. The composition of claim 1, wherein the binder is selected from the group consisting of stearic acid, glycerol monostearate, montmorillonite, monostearin and any mixture thereof.
11. The composition of claim 1, wherein the hydrophobic agent is a fat or an oil, the fat or the oil having an HLB in a range of about 9 to about 11.
12. The composition of claim 11, wherein the hydrophobic agent is mineral oil.
13. The composition of claim 1, wherein the emulsifier is at least one of stearyl monglyceridyl citrate and montmorillonite.
14. The composition of claim 1, further comprising a plant fiber at about 0.01% to about 10% by weight of the composition.

15. The composition of claim 14, wherein the plant fiber comprises at least one of abaca, hemp, bamboo, banana, coir, cotton, jute, kenaf, sisal, straw, remine, bagasse, sugar cane, wood and cellulose.
16. The composition of claim 15. wherein the plant fiber is at least one of sugarcane fiber and hemp.
17. The composition of claim 1, having a melting point range of about 120 C to about 180 C.
18. The composition of claim 1, having a melting point range of about 130 C to about 170 C.
19. The composition of claim 1, having a density between about 0.005 g/cm3 to about 0.35 g/cm3 at 25 oC.

20. A biodegradable foam pellet composition, the composition comprising: a starch at about 20% to about 85% by weight of the composition, a plasticizer at about 2% to about 30% by weight of the composition; a flexibility agent at about 5% to about 40% by weight; a binder at about 0.1% to about 15% by weight of the composition; a defoaming agent at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition; a hydrophobic agent at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition; and an emulsifier at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition.
21. The composition of claim 20, wherein the starch is a starch powder selected from the group consisting of com starch, wheat starch, potato starch, buckwheat starch and any mixture thereof.
22. The composition of claim 21, wherein the starch powder is at least one of unprocessed potato powder and unprocessed corn starch powder.
23. The composition of claim 20, wherein the starch has an amylose to amylopectin ratio of about 1 :2 to about 1 :5.
24. The composition of claim 20, wherein the starch has a moisture content of between about 15% to 25% by weight of the starch.
25. The composition of claim 20, wherein the plasticizer is selected from the group consisting of glycerol, ethylene glycol, polyglycerol and any mixture thereof.
26. The composition of claim 25, wherein the plasticizer is glycerol.
27. The composition of claim 20, wherein the flexibility agent is urea, citric acid, a polyol or any mixture thereof.
28. The composition of claim 27, wherein the polyol is selected from the group consisting of sorbitol, D-glucitol, mannitol, polyethylene glycol, polyvinyl alcohol and polyglycerol.
29. The composition of claim 20, wherein the binder is selected from the group consisting of stearic acid, glycerol monostearate, montmorillonite, monostearin and any mixture thereof.
30. The composition of claim 20, wherein the hydrophobic agent is a fat or an oil, the fat or the oil having an HLB in a range of about 9 to about 11.
31. The composition of claim 30, wherein the hydrophobic agent is mineral oil.
32. The composition of claim 20, wherein the emulsifier is at least one of stearyl monglyceridyl citrate and montmorillonite.
33. The composition of claim 20, further comprising a plant fiber at about 0.01% to about 10% by weight of the composition.

34. The composition of claim 33, wherein the plant fiber comprises at least one of abaca, hemp, bamboo, banana, coir, cotton, jute, kenaf, sisal, straw, remine, bagasse, sugar cane, wood and cellulose.
35. The composition of claim 34, wherein the plant fiber is at least one of sugarcane fiber and hemp.
36. The composition of claim 20, The composition of claim 20, wherein the defoaming agent is calcium carbonate.
37. The composition of claim 20, having a melting point range of about 100C to about 200C.
38. The composition of claim 37 having a melting point range of about 120C to about 190C.
39. The composition of claim 20 having a density between about 0.005 g/cm3 to about 0.35 g/cm3 at 25C.

40. A method of making a biodegradable plastic pellet composition, the method comprising: mixing a starch, a flexibility agent and a binder to produce a first mixture; adding a solution of a plasticizer, a hydrophobic agent and an emulsifier to the first mixture to produce a second mixture; sealing the second mixture at a sealing temperature for a sealing period to produce a third mixture; extruding the third mixture to produce an extrudate; and forming the extrudate into pellets; wherein the biodegradable plastic pellet composition comprises: the at least one starch at about 20% to about 85% by weight of the composition, a plasticizer at about 2% to about 30% by weight of the composition; the at least one flexibility agent at about 5% to about 40% by weight; the at least one binder at about 0.1% to about 15% by weight of the composition; a defoaming agent at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition; a hydrophobic agent at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition; and an emulsifier at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition.
41. The method of claim 40, wherein the sealing temperature is between about 20C and about 30C.
42. The method of claim 40, wherein the sealing period is between about 24 hours and 60 hours.
43. The method of claim 42, wherein the sealing period is between about 30 hours and 50 hours.
44. The method of claim 40, wherein extruding the third mixture occurs over a temperature range of from about 50C to about 100C.
45. The method of claim 44, wherein extruding the third mixture occurs over a temperature range of from about 60C to about 90C.
46. The method of claim 40, further comprises adding to the first mixture, plant fibers at about 0.01% to about 10% by weight of the composition.

47. A method of making a biodegradable plastic pellet composition, the method comprising: mixing a starch and a solution of a plasticizer to produce a first mixture; adding a flexibility agent, a binder, a hydrophobic agent and an emulsifier to the first mixture to produce a second mixture; sealing the second mixture at a sealing temperature for a sealing period to produce a third mixture; extruding the third mixture to produce an extrudate; and forming the extrudate into pellets; wherein the biodegradable plastic pellet composition comprises: the at least one starch at about 20% to about 85% by weight of the composition, the plasticizer at about 2% to about 30% by weight of the composition; the 

 at least one flexibility agent at about 10% to about 40% by weight of the composition; the at least one binder at about 0.5% to about 15% by weight of the composition; the hydrophobic agent at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition; and the emulsifier at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition.
48. The method of claim 47, wherein the sealing temperature is between about 20C and about 30C.
49. The method of claim 47, wherein the sealing period is between about 24 hours and 60 hours.
50. The method of claim 49, wherein the sealing period is between about 30 hours and 50 hours.
51. The method of claim 47, wherein extruding the third mixture occurs over a temperature range of from about 50C to about 100C.
52. The method of claim 51, wherein extruding the third mixture occurs over a temperature range of from about 60C to about 90C.
53. The method of claim 47, further comprises adding to the first mixture, plant fibers at about 0.01% to about 10% by weight of the composition.

54. A method of making a biodegradable foam pellet composition, the method comprising: mixing a starch, a flexibility agent and a binder to produce a first mixture; adding a solution of a plasticizer, a defoaming agent, a hydrophobic agent and an emulsifier to the first mixture to produce a second mixture; sealing the second mixture at a sealing temperature for a sealing period to produce a third mixture; extruding the third mixture to produce an extrudate; and forming the extrudate into pellets; wherein the biodegradable foam composition comprises: the starch at about 20% to about 85% by weight of the composition, the plasticizer at about 2% to about 30% by weight of the composition; the flexibility agent at about 5% to about 40% by weight; the binder at about 0.1% to about 15% by weight of the composition; the defoaming agent at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition; the hydrophobic agent at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition; and the emulsifier at about 0.1% to about 5% by weight of the composition.
55. The method of claim 54, wherein the sealing temperature is between about 20C and about 30C.
56. The method of claim 54, wherein the sealing period is between about 15 hours and 60 hours.
57. The method of claim 56, wherein the sealing period is between about 20 hours and 50 hours.
58. The method of claim 54, wherein extruding the third mixture occurs over a temperature range of from about 50C to about 170C.
59. The method of claim 54, wherein extruding the third mixture occurs over a temperature range of from about 60C to about 150C.
60. The method of claim 54, further comprises adding to the first mixture, plant fibers at about 0.01% to about 10% by weight of the composition.
